title: Art Institute of Chicago 43rd Annual Exhibition by Artists of Chicago Vintage Poster
description:
Poster developed from the Art Institute of Chicago’s 43rd Annual Exhibition of Artists of Chicago poster from 1939.

Add a piece of art history to your home with our modern reproduction of a 1939 Art Institute of Chicago exhibition poster. Held annually for over a century, the American Paintings and Sculpture shows offered an important exhibition opportunity for the most distinguished American artists working both at home and abroad.

This poster features an image of our lion who "stands in an attitude of defiance", with his tail pointing up.  Edward Kemeys created the Lions in 1893, which flank the main entrance to the Art Institute of Chicago.

  • Dimensions: 36 x 24 in.
  • Premium Cardstock.
  • Matte Finish.

Additional Shipping $15 per Order.

This item cannot be shipped to a destination outside the United States.
